alert.note: Alert for Coastal Waldo; Interior Waldo; Knox (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 18 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Recent heavy rainfall has left soils saturated and drainages near bankfull. Additional rainfall tonight may lead to flooding of urban areas and small streams on the Midcoast. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following areas, Coastal Waldo, Interior Waldo and Knox. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of rainfall is possible overnight tonight depending on how far west heavy rainfall banding progresses. It may stay just to the east of the watch area but could also deliver another inch or so if banding moves more westward. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
